page.title: 08CHURCHES AND CHAPELS.
page.content: There is a church in each of the six villages but only one chapel. Kimpton, Thruxton and Fyfield share the same vicar, Ian Tomlinson. He takes a weekly Assembly in Kimpton School. Thruxton Church was built in 1274 and Fyfield in 1370 whereas Kimpton is early Victorian. Amport and Monxton are two of the parishes of which the vicar is Michael Grylls who is also the Rural Dean. The vicar comes into Amport School every other week to take Assembly; the older children go to Amport Church to learn bellringing & the whole school often visits the church for services. Amport Church dates from 1320 & Monxton from 1466. Weyhill has an Australian vicar, Ed Bennett who also has three parishes. The only Methodist Chapel,in Amport, dates from 1928. Part of the Andover Circuit, its minister is Mark Alsop.
